div.p: This section of our Website contains general information about our school district.

img.alt: Student working with adult at an elementary school

div.p: Hamden has eight elementary schools (grades K-6), one middle school (grades 7-8) and one high school (grades 9-12). In addition, Hamden has an early learning center and an alternative high school.
Our Board of Education is composed of nine elected members. Board and committee meetings are open to the public and generally are held at 60 Putnam Avenue.

br.br: Hamden has great programs and staff available to our students! This section of our Website includes information about our curriculum and instruction, and special programming.

li.a: Hamden Teacher of the Year Program

div.p: Hamden is proud of our many athletic teams for both boys and girls. This section of our Website includes all you need to know to participate in Hamden athletics as a student athlete or spectator!

img.alt: Hamden High School hockey team skating during a game.

div.div: The Department of Fine and Performing Arts has a long history of providing students opportunities to explore their talents in music, visual arts and theatre. The arts are an integral component of educating the whole child. The arts are alive in Hamden Public Schools!

div.p: This section includes information for current Hamden Public Schools employees as well as notices and application information for prospective employees.
This section of our site is designed to help you easily find the most commonly sought information on the Hamden Public Schools Website. Jump in and take a look!

img.alt: Image of girl jumping long jump.

div.p: Under the Families First Coronavirus Response Act, employees are provided certain rights to paid sick leave and expanded family and medical leave. The poster below describes eligibility requirements and entitlements.
